intro: Hieracium stiptadenioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. It is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
